title: Fei-Fei Li, discreet pioneer of artificial intelligence
description: Strangely absent from a 'New York Times' ranking of key AI figures, the Chinese-born American researcher has nonetheless worked to exponentially increase the learning capabilities of computers. Today, she is committed to putting technology at the service of humanity.

title: US regulators authorize first bitcoin funds on public markets
description: Regulators approved proposals for 11 ETFs to list on leading exchanges including the New York Stock Exchange 'on an accelerated basis,' the Securities and Exchange Commission said on Wednesday. The decision is expected to boost the cryptocurrency.

title: Greece to legalize same-sex marriage and adoption
description: Greece's center-right government will soon submit legislation allowing same-sex civil marriages, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said Wednesday. He stressed that the proposed law would nevertheless not extend the right to future parenthood through surrogate mothers to same-sex couples.

title: Norway could become the first country to mine its own seabed despite massive opposition
description: The Scandinavian kingdom authorized exploration of a large part of its continental shelf on Tuesday, searching for zinc, copper and rare-earth metals, despite major protests.

title: France's post office trials  changing rooms for online shoppers
description: Certain branches of La Poste will offer customers the chance to instantly return items that do not fit after trying them on in new stand-alone changing rooms.

title: Judge bars  Trump from giving his own closing argument at his civil fraud trial
description: The trial could cost Trump hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties and strip him of his ability to do business in New York

title: WHO warns Covid-19 still poses a deadly threat
description: Besides the almost 10,000 deaths reported to the WHO in December, there was a 42% increase in hospitalizations and a 62% increase in intensive care unit admissions, compared with November.

title: Europe faced migration resurgence from Africa in 2023
description: The number of migrants and refugees coming to Europe by sea has risen by two-thirds, mostly via Tunisia and the Canary Islands.

title: Italy's government under fire from opposition after fascist rally in Rome
description: Italy's interior minister said on Wednesday that dozens of people who made the fascist salute in Rome on Sunday behaved 'contrary to our democratic culture,' following opposition party pressure on Prime Minister Meloni.

title: Amazon's live-streaming platform Twitch cuts 500 jobs
description: Twitch has recently suffered an exodus of top executives amid a massive cost-cutting campaign across Amazon units.

title: What we know about the unfolding violence in Ecuador
description: At least 10 people have been killed in a series of attacks blamed on gangs as the country is becoming engulfed by what the president called an 'internal armed conflict.'

title: Post Office scandal: UK to exonerate and compensate wrongly convicted staff
description: One of Britain's 'greatest miscarriages of justice,' the wrongful conviction of hundreds of Post Office workers due to faulty software has exploded into the public domain following a TV drama, with demands for justice for those targeted.

title: US experiences 'historic' drop in crime rates, contrary to public perception
description: According to a recent study, murders declined by almost 13% in 2023 and burglaries were down by more than 6%. But this hasn't stopped the majority of Americans from being convinced that the situation is getting worse instead of better.

title: The risky gamble of naming Gabriel Attal prime minister
description: As former government spokesman and education minister, the new French PM is no stranger to the challenges ahead. But does his appointment come too soon?

title: Bhutan dreams of building the first 'mindfulness' city
description: The Himalayan kingdom, which  has chosen to prioritize the environment over growth, is facing a 'brain drain.'

title: 'By appointing a strong figure as PM Macron has – finally! – shown he is capable of reforming himself'
description: By appointing Gabriel Attal, the French president has implicitly conceded that he needs his youth and popularity to breathe new life into his second term, writes Le Monde columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: EU may lower protection status of wolves
description: Farmers have long called for the change, due to the predator's impact on livestock. But the move is also being denounced by environmental protection organizations.

title: French PM Attal's other challenge: Countering the far-right in European elections
description: The new Prime Minister is expected to be a campaign leader, as the presidential bloc has only 5 months to overtake Le Pen's Rassemblement National, which is leading in the European election polls.

title: 'The destabilizing shockwave of a Trump re-election would reach far beyond Europe'
description: With polls showing him as the favorite, it's not too early to assess the impact of a second term for the former Republican president. His victory would have a profoundly destabilizing effect on international relations, explains columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: JPR Williams, Wales and British Lions rugby legend, dies aged 74
description: A three-time Five Nations Grand Slam winner with his country, he also boasted an unbeaten record in eight Tests as a Lion in historic triumphant tours to New Zealand in 1971 and 1974 in South Africa.

title: Chinese military tells US it will 'never compromise' on Taiwan
description: Chinese military officials urged their US counterparts to stop 'provocative actions' in the South China Sea at talks this week in Washington, Beijing said Wednesday.

title: Natural disasters cause $250 billion in annual damages, a 'new normal' for insurers
description: According to reinsurer Munich Re, insured losses fell by nearly 25% in 2023, dropping to $95 billion from 2022's $125 billion. Meanwhile, storm-related damages have escalated to record highs.

title: David Chase: 'A lot of what was in The Sopranos was me and my life and my parents'
description: To celebrate the 25th anniversary of the first episode of the series that revolutionized American television fiction, its creator spoke to Le Monde about its groundbreaking beginnings.

title: Erotic fantasies, a secret garden to be cultivated
description: Sexual fantasy is increasingly evaporating under the blows of technology and self-censorship, observes columnist Maïa Mazaurette, who pleads for maintaining the right to engage in erotic reveries without moral judgment.

title: France's defense industry threatened by new competitors
description: South Korea, Turkey and Israel are formidable competitors for the French military-industrial sector which, despite its strengths and its position as the world's third largest arms exporter, has a number of shortcomings.

title: Boeing CEO takes responsibility for Alaska Airlines incident
description: Dave Calhoun on Tuesday promised to deal with the issue with 'complete transparency every step of the way' and acknowledged the company's 'mistake.'

title: BBC Slovak journalist suspected of being Czechoslovak secret service agent in London
description: According to an investigation by the UK's 'Daily Mail' newspaper, Terezia Javorska is suspected of having relayed information to the Czechoslovak Communist intelligence services in the 1980s, although the specifics of her involvement remain uncertain.
